result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. VICTOR M AVILA-FARIAS

records.addlTxt:
9:44 am Defendant VICTOR M AVILA-FARIAS in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Susan Rascon sworn to interpret.  The DE states he has hired an attorney but has forgot the name.  He did show the interpreter a picture of a Goldin and Lennon office sign.  The Court will set another status hearing.  Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Status hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.

9:34 AM Defendant VICTOR M AVILA-FARIAS in court.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Susan Rascon sworn to interpreter.  The Sates notes that the offer in this case and changed.  The DE now wants to hire an attorney.  Advised of rights.  Victim addresses the court.  Bond Continues.
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.

No violent contact with V1 or W1 in Oshkosh PD report # 22-20188.You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7) to room 15, lower level of the Courthouse.  Due to COVID-19 you will need to call 920-236-4906 BEFORE reporting. No possession of firearms or machete.

8:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam Joseph Levin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant VICTOR M AVILA-FARIAS in court.  Susan Rascone sworn to interpret.  The DE takes the offer the State recommends.  The Court will set a plea/sent date. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. 
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
**The Court will hold the $150 cash bond and use towards fine/costs at the next hearing**

10:08 AM Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant VICTOR M AVILA-FARIAS in court. Advised of rights.  Given copy of complaint.  Defendant indicates he wants an attorney and interpreter.  Court adjourns initial appearance.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
to appear on Tuesday, August 09, 2022 at 10:00 am - Branch 3
